FuncDef:
The ssm-mapping command configures static Source-Specific Multicast (SSM) mapping rules.
The undo ssm-mapping command deletes the configured static SSM mapping rules. The ssm-mapping command configures static Source-Specific Multicast (SSM) mapping rules. The undo ssm-mapping command deletes the configured static SSM mapping rules. By default, SSM mapping rules are not configured. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K, CE6820S, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the IPv6 address of a multicast group configured with SSM mapping.
The address ranges from FF00:: to FFFF:FFFF:FFFF:FFFF:FFFF:FFFF:FFFF:FFFF, in the hexadecimal format.

Specifies the mask length of an IPv6 multicast group address.
The value is an integer, which can be 16, 32, 64, or 128.

Specifies the IPv6 address of a multicast source.
The address is in the hexadecimal format.

Deletes all the configured static SSM mapping rules.
-
